name: gops
description: Tool to list and diagnose Go processes currently running on your system

repo.name: gops
repo.description: A tool to list and diagnose Go processes currently running on your system

readme.summary: Excellent clarity and installation instructions with comprehensive command examples, but lacks troubleshooting guidance and configuration details for the diagnostics agent.
readme.top_issue: No troubleshooting section for common issues like permission errors, agent connection failures, or what to do when processes don't show the diagnostic agent marker

injection_risks.description: The handle function does not validate the input message before using it in a switch statement, which could potentially lead to unexpected behavior if an unknown message type is received.
The SetGCPercent function does not validate the input percentage before setting it, which could potentially lead to unexpected behavior if a very large or small value is provided.

critical_findings: Potential for unexpected behavior due to lack of input validation in handle function
security.summary: The gops agent has some potential security concerns related to input validation and error exposure, but overall it appears to be a relatively secure package.

common_complaints: No releases in over 2 years despite useful updates
Feature requests unanswered with no engagement
Missing functionality for heap dump debugging
sentiment.summary: Project shows signs of stagnation with unresponsive maintainers, no recent releases, and unaddressed feature requests accumulating over months, indicating declining community health.

communication.summary: The maintainer responses are clear, helpful, and patient. They provide technical depth and encourage new contributors.

concerns: No commits in past 6 months despite last commit being recent (2026-01-08)
33 open issues with no recent activity or resolution
No closed issues in past 6 months indicating lack of maintenance activity
No merged PRs in past 6 months showing no active development
Zero active contributors in past 6 months
Unknown last release date suggests release history may not be tracked
positive_signals: Last commit is very recent (2026-01-08), suggesting some minimal activity
maintenance.summary: The gops project shows signs of staleness with no meaningful maintenance activity over the past 6 months despite a recent single commit, accumulating unresolved issues without developer engagement.

project_metrics.description: A tool to list and diagnose Go processes currently running on your system

analysis_summary.doc_summary: The documentation is generally clear and provides a good overview of the package's functionality, but could benefit from more troubleshooting information.
concerns: No commits in the past six months, indicating a lack of recent development or updates.
A high number of open issues (24) and PRs (10) suggests potential problems that have not been addressed recently.
Docs: Lack of comprehensive troubleshooting section
Security: Potential for unexpected behavior due to lack of input validation in handle function
highlights: Recent activity with merged PRs (1) within the last six months indicates some level of ongoing engagement.
Multiple contributors active in the past six months suggest a community or group effort to maintain the package.
